intro: Tragia mitis var. kirkii, commonly known as the Kirk's tragia, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, hairy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often with a distinctive glandular appearance. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
